alert.note: Alert for Clark; Coles; Douglas; Edgar (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 2:28PM CDT until July 07 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Illinois, including the following counties, Clark, Coles, Douglas and Edgar. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over primarily eastern parts of the advisory area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paris, Oakland, Kansas, Ashmore, Brocton, Vermilion, Redmon, Isabel, Bell Ridge, Borton and Edgar County Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
